Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. William Grant, Pastor, Tribeca Spiritual Center, 295 Greenwich Street, New York, New York 10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gerson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. William Grant, Pastor, Tribeca Spirtual Center, 295 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007.

Council Member Gerson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 25, 2007 be adopted as printed by Council Member Vacca.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Vacca moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 25, 2007 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 080020 PQX, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. C 080019 HAX that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, 860 East 161st Street, Bronx (C080020PQX)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Economic Development
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regionally significant projects and empire zones.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Regionally significant projects and empire zones.

Items.Title: Resolution pursuant to the New York State Environmental Quality Review Act setting forth findings of the Council concerning the environmental review conducted for Int. No. 626.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Regionally significant projects and empire zones.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to tax appeals and the creation of an office of administrative tax appeals composed of the tax commission and the tax appeals tribunal; and to repeal a provision of the charter of the city of New York relating to the tax appeals tribunal.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: In relation to tax appeals and the creation of an office of administrative tax appeals composed of the tax commission and the tax appeals tribunal.

Items.Title: Resolution endorsing the Speaker’s decision to file, on behalf of the Council, an amicus brief in support of the Plaintiffs in the litigation between several states and the federal government captioned New York v. U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, for the purpose of supporting the wide latitude granted to states by the State Children’s Health Insurance Program (“SCHIP”) to set their own income rules for SCHIP eligibility.
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Speaker’s decision to file, on behalf of the Council, an amicus brief in support of the Plaintiffs in the litigation between several states and the federal government captioned New York v. U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to tax exemption and abatement for certain rehabilitated buildings as authorized by section 488-a of the real property tax law.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Tax exemption and abatement for certain rehabilitated buildings as authorized by section 488-a of the real property tax law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exemption from taxation of alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on Application No. N 070412 ZRM, an amendment to the text of the Zoning Resolution, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, concerning the Special Lower Manhattan District (Article IX, Chapter 1), relating to modifications of the applicability of urban plazas, height and setback regulations and a special permit for development over or adjacent to the approaches to the Brooklyn Battery Tunnel in Community District 1, Borough of Manhattan (L.U. No. 601).

Items.MatterName: LU 601 - ULURP, 50 West Street, Manhattan (N070412ZRM)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 070413 ZSM (L.U. No. 602), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 91-73 of the Zoning Resolution to allow the unmapped air space above the approaches to the Brooklyn Battery Tunnel to be considered a single zoning lot and to allow such zoning lot to include contiguous area of land to facilitate the development of a mixed use development on property located at 50 West Street (Block 17, Lots 1001-1005 and Block 18, p/o Lot 100), in a C6-9 District, within the Special Lower Manhattan District, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 602 - ULURP, 50 West Street, Manhattan (C070413ZSM)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 070414 ZSM (L.U. No. 603), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 91-35 of the Zoning Resolution to modify the setback requirements of Section 91-32 (Setback Regulations) in connection with the construction of a mixed use development on property located at 50 West Street (Block 17, Lots 1001-1005 and Block 18, p/o Lot 100), in a C6-9 District, within the Special Lower Manhattan District, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 603 - ULURP, 50 West Street, Manhattan (C070414ZSM)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 604 - ULURP, 50 West Street, Manhattan (C070415ZSM)

Items.MatterName: LU 608 - ULURP, Century 21 Bay Ridge, Brooklyn (C070203ZMK)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 070204 ZSK (L.U. No. 609), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-512 of the Zoning Resolution to allow a seven-level unattended public parking garage with a maximum capacity of 279 spaces and to permit floor space on three levels (part of 1st and 3rd levels and the 2nd level) up to a height of 23 feet above curb level to be exempted from the definition of floor area as set forth in Section 12-10 (Definitions) of the Zoning Resolution and to permit public parking spaces to be located on the roofs (part of 5th level and 7th level) of the public parking garage to facilitate the enlargement of a commercial development at 416 to 450 87th Street and 415 to 435 88th Street (Block 6050, Lots 15, 19, 51 and 59), in a C4-2A District, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 609 - ULURP, Century 21 Bay Ridge, Brooklyn (C070204ZSK)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 611 - ULURP, 1113 York Avenue, Manhattan (C070441ZSM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution pursuant to the New York State Environmental Quality Review Act setting forth findings of the Council concerning the environmental review conducted for Int. No. 626.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Regionally significant projects and empire zones.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to posting information regarding preventing the spread of communicable diseases at schools and day care centers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Posting information regarding preventing the spread of communicable diseases at schools and day care centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting smoking on and around hospital grounds.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting smoking on and around hospital grounds.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the City Administrative Procedure Act of the New York City Charter, to require that all agencies electronically transmit copies of proposed rules in a timely manner.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Amend the City Administrative Procedure Act of the NYC Charter, to require that all agencies electronically transmit copies of proposed rules in a timely manner.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Senate to pass S.2811, which would create a rehabilitation program of civic service, education, and job training to assist non-violent felony offenders reintegrate successfully into society.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Create a rehabilitation program of civic service, education, and job training to assist non-violent felony offenders reintegrate successfully into society. (S.2811)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a voluntary emergency medical service patient registry.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a voluntary emergency medical service patient registry.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency evacuation and community notification plans for certain buildings that have received a variance to store diesel fuel or store more than a threshold amount of diesel fuel.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Emergency evacuation and community notification plans for certain buildings that have received a variance to store diesel fuel or store more than a threshold amount of diesel fuel.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass and President George W. Bush to approve legislation extending the right of first refusal to federally funded Project-based Section 8 developments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Approve legislation extending the right of first refusal to federally funded Project-based Section 8 developments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for changes in the New York City Family Court system to better protect battered women and parents who reasonably believe that their child is threatened by child abuse or domestic violence that is perpetrated or permitted by the child’s other parent.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Changes in the New York City Family Court system to better protect battered women and parents who reasonably believe that their child is threatened by child abuse or domestic violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make nurses available to public and private high schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make nurses available to public and private high schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the installation of nitrous oxide tanks in automobiles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the installation of nitrous oxide tanks in automobiles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing legal counsel for certain tenants subject to eviction, ejectment or foreclosure proceedings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Providing legal counsel for certain tenants subject to eviction, ejectment or foreclosure proceedings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass S.1113/H.R.2048, also known as the “Traumatic Brain Injury Access to Options Act.”
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Traumatic Brain Injury Access to Options Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing information to schools regarding communicable diseases.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Providing information to schools regarding communicable diseases.

Items.Title: Resolution endorsing the Speaker’s decision to file, on behalf of the Council, an amicus brief in support of the Plaintiffs in the litigation between several states and the federal government captioned New York v. U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, for the purpose of supporting the wide latitude granted to states by the State Children’s Health Insurance Program (“SCHIP”) to set their own income rules for SCHIP eligibility.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Speaker’s decision to file, on behalf of the Council, an amicus brief in support of the Plaintiffs in the litigation between several states and the federal government captioned New York v. U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign into law the Paycheck Fairness Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Paycheck Fairness Act

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to biological, chemical and radiological detectors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Permits for atmospheric biological, chemical and radiological detectors.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass the “Thomas J. Manton Prostate Cancer Early Detection and Treatment Act of 2007” (S. 1275 and H.R. 2131), which would amend the Public Health Service Act and Title XIX of the Social Security Act to provide for a screening and treatment program for prostate cancer in the same manner as is provided for breast and cervical cancer.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Thomas J. Manton Prostate Cancer Early Detection and Treatment Act of 2007. (S.1275/H.R.2131)

Items.Title: Application no. 20085165 HAK, an Urban Development Action Area Project known as CB Emmanuel/MDG Design, located in Community Board 16, Council District no. 41, Borough of Brooklyn.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development and pursuant to Section 696 of the General Municipal Law for an exemption from real property taxes.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: UDAAP,  CB Emmanuel/MDG Design, Brooklyn (20085165HAK)

Items.Title: Application no. 20085166 HAK, an Urban Development Action Area Project known as Marcy Willoughby, located in Community Board 3, Council District no. 36, Borough of Brooklyn. Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 533 Hudson Street, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20075254 TCM.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, BacBars Group LLC, Manhattan (20075254TCM)

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Speake (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of the following individual:

Green Beret Major Jeffrey Calero, 34 of Queens Village (C.M. Weprin’s district), who died on October 29, 2007 in Afghanistan when an improvised explosive device detonated while he was on dismounted patrol.  He was assigned to the 1st Battalion, 20th Special Forces Group based out of Springfield, Massachusetts.
